Series.Actors: |Corey Carrier|Sean Patrick Flanery|Lloyd Owen|George Hall|Ruth de Sosa|Margaret Tyzack|Ronny Coutteure|
Series.Overview:
The Young Indiana Jones Chronicles was based on the Indiana Jones series of films. The series follows the Indiana Jones character (as a young boy and as a young man) as he was growing up and experiencing his early adventures, where he gets into trouble, learns life lessons and encounters various historical figures along the way.
The Young Indiana Jones Chronicles was filmed on location all over the world ~ including England, Russia, Spain, Czechoslovakia, Kenya, France, India, China, Austria, Egypt, the United States, Morocco, Ireland, Italy, Africa, Turkey, Greece and Thailand.

Episode.EpisodeName: The Curse of the Jackal, Egypt 1908 (1)
Episode.GuestStars: |Margaret Tyzack|Ruth DeSosa|Lloyd Owen|Joseph Bennett|Tony Robinson|Pip Torrens|Tariq Alibai|Vic Tablian|
Episode.Overview: While on an archeological dig in Egypt, young Indy uncovers an ancient mummy and a fresh corpse. With the help of T.E. Lawrence Indy becomes involved in an intriguing murder mystery.

Episode.EpisodeName: The Curse of the Jackal, Mexico, March 1916 (2)
Episode.Overview: To keep him from getting into any more trouble, Indy is sent to visit his aunt in New Mexico. While there, he is kidnapped by Pancho Villa and swept up into the Mexican Revolution.

Episode.EpisodeName: The Perils of Cupid, London, May 1916
Episode.GuestStars: |Margaret Tyzack|Elizabeth Hurley|Jane Wyatt|Kika Markham|Julian Fellowes|Elizabeth Redgrave|
Episode.Overview: In England Indy gets into trouble when his love affair with a strong-willed young woman is derailed by her fervent belief in the women's suffrage movement and her need for independence.

Episode.GuestStars: |Margaret Tyzack|Ruth DeSosa|Lloyd Owen|Isaac Senteu Supeyo|James Gammon|Paul Freeman|Edward Tudor-Pole|
Episode.Overview: Young Indy meets the 26th President of the United States, Theodore Roosevelt while on safari in Kenya.

Episode.GuestStars: |Bernard Fresson|Jean Rougerie|Igor De Savitch|Cris Campion|James Nesbitt|
Episode.Overview: Indy addresses the morality of leadership when confronted with military officials who have little disregard for the lives of the men they command.

Episode.GuestStars: |Bryan Pringle|Michel Duchaussoy|Isaach De BankolÃ©|Friedrich Von Thun|
Episode.Overview: On a military mission, Indy rescues a small child in an African village, and encounters the legendary Albert Schweitzer, and helps him in his jungle hospital.

Episode.GuestStars: |Bryan Pringle|Emile Abossolo M`bo|Isolde Barth|Yann Colette|Friedrich Von Thun|
Episode.Overview: On a military mission, Indy rescues a small child in an African village, and encounters the legendary Albert Schweitzer, and helps him in his jungle hospital.
Indy, in an attempt to end the war, enlists the aid of Habsburg royalty when he embarks on a dangerous diplomatic mission through enemy-held Europe into the palace of the Emperor of Austria.

As a young soldier in the Belgian Army, Indy learns the savagery of warfare while participating in the Battle of the Somme and amongst all the turmoil, Indy wonders if he won't live to see the war end.
Indy is captured by the Germans and confined to a POW camp where he and fellow prisoner Charles de Gaulle hatch a daring scheme to escape..
Indy goes undercover as a dancer for the Ballet Russe in Spain, where he runs into an old friend, Pablo Picasso.

Episode.EpisodeName: The Mystery of the Blues, Chicago, April 1920 (1)
Episode.Overview: While going to college and working in a speakeasy, Indy meets up jazz great Sidney Bechet who teaches him how to play the blues. Unfortunately, Indy also crosses paths with Al Capone and it's only with the assistance of his dorm roommate, Eliot Ness, that Indy is able to solve a vicious murder and prevent himself from ending up dead.

Episode.EpisodeName: The Mystery of the Blues, Chicago, May 1920 (2)
Episode.Overview: While going to college and working in a speakeasy, Indy meets up jazz great Sidney Bechet who teaches him how to play the blues. Unfortunately, Indy also crosses paths with Al Capone and it's only with the assistance of his dorm roommate, Eliot Ness, that Indy is able to solve a vicious murder and prevent himself from ending up dead.

Indy and his girlfriend, Nancy Stratemeyer (whose father created the Nancy Drew mystery series) visit the fascinating laboratory of inventor Thomas Edison and they must contend with dangerous German spies, as they try to keep Edison's top-secret invention safe.
In Russia, Indy's espionage work threatens more lives when he infiltrates a group of young Bolsheviks and begins to sympathize with their plight, and causes Indy to question his loyality.

Episode.EpisodeName: The Scandal of 1920, New York, June 1920 (1)
Episode.Overview: In New York City, Indy stretches himself thin when he stage-manages a Broadway musical, dates three beatiful women, attends high society parties, reads poetry with Greenwich Village bohemians and trades barbs with the literary wits of the Algonquin Round Table, all accompanied by composer George Gershwin.

Episode.EpisodeName: The Scandal of 1920, New York, July 1920 (2)
Episode.Overview: In New York City, Indy stretches himself thin when he stage-manages a Broadway musical, dates three beatiful women, attends high society parties, reads poetry with Greenwich Village bohemians and trades barbs with the literary wits of the Algonquin Round Table, all accompanied by composer George Gershwin.

Episode.EpisodeName: The Perils of Cupid, Vienna, November 1908
Episode.Overview: On a visit to Vienna, young Indy and his family stay with the American Ambassador in Austria where Indy meets Princess Sophie, the daughter of the heir to the throne, Archduke Franz Ferdinand and is given some advice on the meaning of love from Sigmund Freud, Carl Jung and Alfred Adler.

Episode.EpisodeName: The Phantom Train of Doom, German East Africa, November 1916 (1)
The Phantom Train of Doom, German East Africa, November 1916 (2)

Episode.Overview: In Ireland right before the Easter Rebellion, Indy falls for a beautiful young Colleen, whose brother is mixed up in the Irish resistance movement.
Young Indy meets the iconic artists Norman Rockwell, Pablo Picasso, George Braque, Edgar Degas and Henri Rousseau in Paris.
When Indy goes on leave in Paris and engages in a torrid affair with infamous spy Mata Hari and she shows him that love isn't always grand.
Indy is shipped off to Prague for another mission, this time a very mysterious mission, where Indy is thwarted continuously and Franz Kafka offers him assistance.

Young Indy travels to Florence, Italy with his parents and Helen Seymour, his tutor, where Helen gives him lessons in physics, with examples from Galileo and Leonardo da Vinci. Meanwhile, when Indy's father is temporarily away, the family, notably Indy's mother is charmed by the Italian opera composer Giacomo Puccini.
To earn college tuition money, Indy takes a job as assistant to a film studio executive.

Episode.EpisodeName: Treasure of the Peacock's Eye, London/Egypt, November 1919 (1)
Treasure of the Peacock's Eye, South Pacific, November 1919 (2)
Attack of the Hawkmen, Ravenelle, Germany, 1917 (1)
Episode.Overview: After being assigned to the Lafayette Escadrille flying squadron, Indy encounters notorious German flying ace Baron von Richthofen; then goes undercover to persuade aircraft designer Anthony Fokker to defect from Germany.

Episode.EpisodeName: Attack of the Hawkmen, Ahlgorn, Germany 1917 (2)

Episode.Overview: Young Indy is sold in to a child slavery ring.
